t: Vindicate*pn me, Lord,*s because*ln I have lived with integrity and*ln have trusted in the Lord*s without wavering.
Test*ln me, Lord,*s and try me; examine*ln my heart and mind.
For*ln your faithful love guides me, and*ln I live by your truth.
I*pn do not sit with the worthless or*ln associate with hypocrites.
I*ln hate a crowd of evildoers, and*ln I do not sit with the wicked.
I*ln wash my hands in innocence and*ln go around your altar, Lord,*s
raising*ln my voice in thanksgiving and*ln telling about your wondrous works.
Lord,*spn I love the house where you dwell, the*ln place where your glory resides.
Do*ln not destroy me along with sinners, or*ln my life along with men of bloodshed
in*ln whose hands are evil schemes and*ln whose right hands are filled with bribes.
But*pn I live with integrity; redeem*ln me and be gracious to me.
My*ln foot stands on level ground; I*ln will bless the Lord*s in the assemblies.
